page.title: 08SAMBOURNE
page.content: Sambourne forms part of the ecclesiastical parish of Coughton, though it has been a separate civil parish at least since the 17th century.It is divided from Coughton by Cane Brook,Ryknield Street (here known as Haydon Way ) which crosses the parish from north to south.The village itself,about 2 miles north-west of Coughton,is centred round a small triangular green at the junction of 4 roads and contains several timber-framed buildings of 17th century date.The Green Dragon Inn,a more modern building,has a 17th century extension with timber-framing.
